fields.description:
If a large image is registered and then run for the first time it can fail to boot if the decryption process on the walrus does not finish by the time that NC completes its 6 exponentially backed off attempt to download it.

Subsequent attempts to run the image will succeed once the caching has completed on the Walrus.
fields.summary: Large instance-store images will fail first launch, NC does not wait for caching on Walrus to complete

comments.body: Are there any specific things to watch out for in the walrus logs with regards to this failure?
Need to talk to Dima about this to determine next steps.

There are three general approaches to the problem of an EMI that is not ready at the time of run request from the user:

# have NC poll Walrus for the EMI for some time and download it when it is ready
# accept run-instance from user, but do not forward it to NC until the EMI has been cached
# reject run-instance requests in CLC until the EMI has been cached

Currently, we have a crude implementation of the first approach in the form of retries to download the image. (Admittedly, it is cleaner to have an explicit polling period using HTTP GET or whatnot.) Apparently, the timeout is not long enough, but it can be increased. The second approach is probably more work than is worth, given that NC needs to have logic for retries and timeout anyway.

For 3.4 we are rethinking image management and will probably take approach number three for some image workflows (both 'create-image' and 'import-instance' have a notion of an EMI that is not ready). For the register-then-run workflow, however, approach three is not an option, since according to AWS semantics an EMI goes directly to 'available' after it has been registered. So for that workflow we'll have to continue relying on approach one or two.

As for increasing the timeout, that can be accomplished by increasing the value of {{TOTAL_ATTEMPTS}} constant in {{storage/walrus.c}}. The current value is 6, which results in a total retry period of just over 2 minutes. (The retries start from 2 seconds and grow in powers of 2, but are capped at 300 seconds.) Here are the timeouts for a greater number of attempts:

|| TOTAL_ATTEMPS || Total retry period (min) || Formula ||
| 6 | 2.1 | (2+4+8+16+32+64)/60.0 |
| 7 | 4.2 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128)/60.0 |
| 8 | 8.5 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128+256)/60.0 |
| 9 | 13.5 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128+256+300)/60.0 |
| 10 | 18.5 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128+256+300+300)/60.0 |
| 11 | 23.5 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128+256+300+300+300)/60.0 |
| 12 | 28.5 | (2+4+8+16+32+64+128+256+300+300+300+300)/60.0 |
Is it possible to have a cloud property to control TOTAL_ATTEMPTS in storage/walrus.c ?
It is difficult to propagate cloud properties to back-end components, but it is easy to add a {{eucalyptus.conf}} setting for TOTAL_ATTEMPTS. Would that help, [~dshekhawat]?

There are two things that need to happen here. Adding a variable for TOTAL_ATTEMPTS

This is the short term fix. The long term is a design change where the NC polls for status and does not block on Walrus.

[~neil], [~dmitrii], [~dshekhawat], [~hspencer]

Generally, this is going to happen with large images (i.e. mostly Windows) on systems which have slow disk or networking (as these are being copied).  
I'll create a doc ticket to add something for best practices with large instance store images, namely to use BFEBS images instead.  
Also, this ticket is now about doing the Short Term fix, and I created EUCA-7261 to fix this the correct way, which should be prioritized for 4.0.

Finally, [~neil] we can solve this in 2 ways
  1. Less desirable: Change the TOTAL_ATTEMPTS constant to a higher value, perhaps at least 9
  2. Most desirable: Make TOTAL_ATTEMPTS configurable, which would also require a docs change.
As a long term fix, perhaps its best that we don't actually get the NC to try to download the image until its confirmed cached in Walrus?

For 3.3.1, I bumped up TOTAL_ATTEMPTS to 9.

For 3.4, I will make TOTAL_ATTEMPTS configurable.

[~lwade], do you mean that we refuse instance run requests at CLC until the EMI is known to have been cached? I think that may be problematic architecturally.
Thanks [~dmitrii] , I think the patch it will have no affect on the same issue we see with Broker?
Actually, [~dshekhawat], it should resolve the problem in the Broker, too, as that code is shared by both backends.

Hey [~dmitrii]

I added the following to my NC config then restarted it:
WALRUS_DOWNLOAD_MAX_ATTEMPTS=3

I still saw the NC trying 9 times (ie the default). Anything else i need to do?

False alarm. Looks like the bug is just the hard coded "out of X" attempts line in the log:

2013-09-25 18:22:22  WARN | download attempt 3 of 9

Will open a different bug for that.
No need for another ticket, [~viglesias], I just committed a fix to the hardcoded line.
